sub_title: Senior UX/ Digital Designer at Downstream
summary: Hi, I am Gabriela and I am an award-winning UX Designer, with broad interdisciplinary knowledge of business, technology, and user experience design. My research-led design thinking focuses on human interaction with modern technology and always considers cultural sensitives. I hold a Master of Science in Digital Design from Amsterdam University and a Bachelor’s Degree in Digital Concept Development from KEA – Copenhagen School of Design and Technology.

The ADAA is a global digital media competition for student creators. Connected to industry professionals, academic leaders, and top brands, the ADAA aims to launch the next generation of student careers. With 14 categories, the ADAA is a competition for creative students of all disciplines.

awards.title: Finalist SpinAward Young Talent 2016
awards.description:
teammate: Wojciech Popiel

First edition of International SpinAwards Young Talent:
The SpinAwards (founded back in 1998) are the leading awards for creative digital thinking in Amsterdam. SpinAwards believe Young Talent is an essential part of creativity and innovation. Therefore SpinAwards have already been helping and rewarding Young Talent in the Netherlands for many years. This year the SpinAwards was taking the next step by not only challenging Dutch students to showcase their digital talent but bring International students to the mix.

http://www.spinawards.nl/inzending/bekijken/4455
http://www.spinawards.nl/prijzen/young-talent-international

awards.description:
BE MY EYES - BE MY GUIDE
Hack developed: An app and community based service that matches blind runners with seeing runners in order to assist blind people get more exercise and meet new people.

team: 
Johannes Hultquist 
Gabriela Prattingerova 
Adrian Brink 
Kārlis Eglīt

http://livingitlab.dk/hackathon/

'Hack-a-Disability' is a two-day hackathon – from the 6th-7th of November 2015 - where enthusiastic students from such disciplines as design, programming and business development invent and create prototypes of future Social IT solutions for people with disabilities.

awards.title: The UCN Technology Award
awards.description:
The lecturers of Design, Technology and Business (Graphics) and UCN Technology hereby presents Gabriela Prattingerová with the UCN Technology Award, because she has displayed a particular degree of initiative and talent and has succeeded in combining knowledge, personal and social competencies with responsibility and determination during her studies at UCN.

Gabriela Prattingerová is always positive when it comes to co-operation. She thinks in new ways and shares her knowledge with fellow students and has teken up the challenge in Danish companies with an open mind and an open heart. She is a very talented designer, she has good insight into technological issues and she is engaged and helpful. She has also been part of Idea Factory at UCN.

First of all this award is a symbol of the optimism we feel when we send a graduate out into the business community The graduate who is presented with the award has attracted attention during her studies and has managed to achieve a particular balance between academic discipline and personal relations which will make her an interesting partner in business community.

projects.title: Jordão Conectado - IV Design and technology workshop - cooperation between SENAC Brasil, Copenhagen School of Design and technology and Geoge Brown College Canada
projects.description:
Interdisciplinary teams were asked to design solutions to stimulate an economy based on tourism in the city of Campos do Jordão by means of information and communication technology.
The proposed concept idea focuses on a problem of touristic information accessibility, availability, and coherence. The conducted research showed an overall inability of tourists as well as locals to allocate relevant information about city and events happening in the city. The proposed concept idea consists of Info booths with an interactive board placed on strategic places in the city. The kiosk is designed with sustainability in mind, it is powered by solar energy, it provides wifi to those in its proximity. There is personnel available to answer any kind of questions, help users who might not have high technical literacy to use the interactive board and also provide people with various printed materials such as maps and brochures. On the interactive board, users can explore various points of interest around the city such as attractions, restaurants, doctors, accommodation, transportation, shopping places, toilets and so on. They can easily allocate those places on the map, display directions or see the price range, menus, rating and other relevant information. There is also news feed showcasing all the latest updates about the city. The board also has an interactive feature of taking an image and applying one of the designed filters, that promote attractions and beauty of the city. After providing basic demographic information the image is being sent the selected email address. This data could later be used for future marketing purposes.
Iit was also proposed to create a coherent system that consists of responsive website, various printed materials and coherent city wayfinding system. The future opportunity is to create mobile info booth that could serve the city in peak season where the concentration of the tourists is high, but also as a promotional vehicle in other cities.

contributors.headline: Senior UX/ Digital Designer at Downstream
Líder de Capítulo iOS na Concrete Solutions

projects.title: Friction
projects.description:
Friction is a service consisting of mobile app, that gives people of all abilities interested in making cities more accessible opportunity to report and point at problems of the accessibility in their urban area. Friction aims to cooperate with different institutions for disabled people or institutions dealing with urban accessibility, to make sure that the problem gets the attention of such institutions and possibly gets solved to make urban experience accessible for all the people. With the help of social proof, we can showcase which problems are the most important for the citizens. We aim to turn complaining into good think to get valuable feedback from people, the feedback that will provoke change in urban areas.

The app allows users to upload picture of the friction they feel needs improvement in order to keep the urban area as accessible as possible. The friction post consists of picture, location geotag , description of the problem written by user who uploaded the friction and category it belongs to. These categories are problems for people with movement impairment, vision impairment and hearing impairment.

contributors.headline: Senior UX/ Digital Designer at Downstream

projects.title: KEA Charrette
projects.description:
A charrette is an intensive, collaborative process that brings together students, community members and professionals to develop innovative solutions for complex issues. Over a few short days of brainstorming, discussion and expert consultation, teams create a broad range of ideas around a central theme. 

KEA Charrette goal is to explore how to re-vitalise local and external interest, pride and a sense of belonging to a number of areas located in Copenhagen.
The goal was to develop proposals for digital/physical connections and digital/physical transformations that will give meaning and value to both the local community and visitors to the locality.

contributors.headline: Senior UX/ Digital Designer at Downstream

projects.title: KEA WEEK - DMI project
projects.description:
KEAweek is KEA's largest multidisciplinary project ever. Manifested in a week of workshops, the soul purpose is to develop your knowledge and skills in innovative processes through the use of innovative methods. 

DMI (The Danish Meteorological Institute)
“City weather-makeover” and use of weather data for new applications
DMI has been using Big Data for weather forecasts since before Big Data was a wide known concept. DMI wants to spread the use of their services and data to new target groups and areas.


CONCEPT:
WEWA - Weather wardrobe, app that suggests your daily outfit based on weather data.
By creating an app for smartphones, we make it an easy and fast solution for you in the morning. When you wake up and do not know what to wear? You will then press the WeWa app and it will then tell you what clothing options suit the day, based on the weather data. So WeWa knows if it is snowing, raining, or sunny and therefore how you can dress. By uploading pictures of your own wardrobe WeWa can pull together outfits that you already have in your closet, or it can give you the overall suggestions by categories ex. Wool sweater, pants, rain jacket etc. If you don’t want to do the work yourself. At the bottom of the display there will be an extra option called Missing pieces, it will suggest what garments you are missing and where you can buy them. This could be done in cooperation with bigger retailers like H&M and Magasin. By making the weather data a bit hidden and more interesting for the younger audience, since they will see the opportunity in what to wear without checking a boring weather app. WeWa is connected to the data from DMI and will always stay updated on the latest weather reports, and therefore it will guide you throughout the year.

The concept won first place.

profile_positions.description:
My role through the client project consists of:
- Facilitating discovery workshops with the client team
- Producing discovery workshop summaries and reports
- Concepting and crafting the overall experience and the experience touchpoints - focusing mainly on the digital experience
- Design production (from wire-framing, prototyping, and designing to design review)
- Client training and support (use of the CMS and final Front-End applications)

profile_positions.title: Junior Visual Designer

profile_positions.description:
Working as a graphic designer in student-led company.

Our client - Orkester Norden is summer symphony orchestra consisting of music students from the conservatories in the Nordic and Baltic countries. Orkester Norden provides a platform for young musicians from the northern European region in order to meet, develop and make music together with input from highly respected musicians and composers who want to share their experience and knowledge. As graphic designers we are working on providing posters, programmes, informational and promotional materials for the whole event. We have free hand in coming up with ideas which we think can be interesting for the manager of the project to put into the practice.
profile_positions.title: Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description: During my internship at Tam Tam, I have been working in the content design team. I was responsible for Tam Tam Instagram account for which I had created several concepts and posted one picture every day. I was also creating concepts and content designs for some of the Tam Tam clients' socials media (i.e. Facebook posts). During my internship period, I was also documenting the life around Tam Tam offices, providing Tam Tam with plenty of pictures. And lastly, when there was a need to create a specific picture for some of the Facebook posts or website projects, I was there to help to take these photographs.
